p.MsoAcetate, li.MsoAcetate, div.MsoAcetate
	{mso-style-noshow:yes;
	margin:0in;
	margin-bottom:.0001pt;
	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;
	font-size:8.0pt;
	font-family:Tahoma;
	mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
	mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman";
	color:black;}
span.StyleArial16pt
	{mso-style-name:"Style Arial 16 pt";
	mso-ansi-font-size:16.0pt;
	font-family:Arial;
	mso-ascii-font-family:Arial;
	mso-hansi-font-family:Arial;
	mso-bidi-font-family:Arial;
	font-weight:bold;}
 /* Page Definitions */
 @page
	{mso-footnote-separator:url("g_files/header.html") fs;
	mso-footnote-continuation-separator:url("g_files/header.html") fcs;
	mso-endnote-separator:url("g_files/header.html") es;
	mso-endnote-continuation-separator:url("g_files/header.html") ecs;}

	{size:595.45pt 841.7pt;

	{page:Section1;}
-->
</style>
<!--[if gte mso 10]>

<body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='border-collapse:collapse;mso-yfti-tbllook:480;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;height:16.2pt'>
  <td width=103 rowspan=2 valign=top style='width:77.4pt;background:#E6E6E6;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:16.2pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-font-family:
  "Times New Roman";color:black;mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:
  EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA'><br clear=all style='page-break-before:always'>
  </span>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:60.0pt;font-family:
  Arial;color:#333333'>G<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width=571 colspan=2 valign=top style='width:428.05pt;background:#D9D9D9;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:16.2pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
  24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Working with Small Numbers</span></b><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt;font-family:
  Arial'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:1;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes;height:16.2pt'>
  <td width=285 style='width:214.0pt;background:silver;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
  height:16.2pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Input: </span></b><span
  style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
  style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=285 style='width:214.05pt;background:silver;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
  height:16.2pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
  10.0pt;font-family:Arial'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<h5 style='text-align:justify'><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Working with summation is easy
but sometimes tricky as well, especially when we have to deal with very small
numbers within them. For example given the value of m, n you have to find the
value of the following expression:</span></span><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:
normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h5>

<h5 align=center style='text-align:center'><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:normal;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shapetype id="_x0000_t75"
 coordsize="21600,21600" o:spt="75" o:preferrelative="t" path="m@4@5l@4@11@9@11@9@5xe"
 filled="f" stroked="f">
 <v:stroke joinstyle="miter"/>
 <v:formulas>
  <v:f eqn="if lineDrawn pixelLineWidth 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 1 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum 0 0 @1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @2 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 0 1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @6 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @8 21600 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @10 21600 0"/>
 </v:formulas>
 <v:path o:extrusionok="f" gradientshapeok="t" o:connecttype="rect"/>
 <o:lock v:ext="edit" aspectratio="t"/>
</v:shapetype><v:shape id="_x0000_i1025" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:408.75pt;
 height:63.75pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/112/g_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=545 height=85
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/112/g_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1025"><![endif]><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1025"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1246790108">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]--><o:p></o:p></span></span></h5>

<p class=MsoNormal>Or in other words if <span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:normal;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id="_x0000_i1026"
 type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:369.75pt;height:53.25pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/112/g_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=493 height=71
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/112/g_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1026"><![endif]><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1026"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1246790109">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]--></span></span>, then you will have to find the values of a
and b. Here <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>a</i></b> and <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>b</i></b> are two relative prime integers.
The values of <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>a</i></b> and <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>b</i></b> will not always fit even in a
64-bit unsigned integer.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h5 style='text-align:justify'><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Input</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h5>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The input file contains 2000 lines
of inputs. Each line contains two integers which denotes the values of m and n
(<sub><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id="_x0000_i1027" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:111pt;
 height:15.75pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/112/g_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=148 height=21
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/112/g_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1027"><![endif]></sub><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1027"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1246790110">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]-->) respectively. Input is terminated by a line containing two
zeroes. This line should not be processed.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h4><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt'>Output <o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>For each line of input produce
four lines of outputs. The descriptions of these four lines are given below:</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The first line of each set
contains the serial of output. Next line prints out the value of a, the third
line contains the dividing line of the fraction and the fourth line contains
the value of b. The length of the dividing line is equal to the length of b.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Print a blank line after the
output of each set of input. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal'>Sample
Input<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                               </span>Output
for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:
 solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=319 valign=top style='width:239.4pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>30
  30<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span

  5<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span

  0<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width=330 valign=top style='width:247.5pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;

  <p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span

  1:<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

	{margin:0in;

	mso-pagination:widow-orphan;

	{margin:0in;

<body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='border-collapse:collapse;mso-yfti-tbllook:480;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;height:16.2pt'>
  <td width=103 rowspan=2 valign=top style='width:77.4pt;background:#E6E6E6;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:16.2pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-font-family:
  "Times New Roman";color:black;mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:
  EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA'><br clear=all style='page-break-before:always'>
  </span>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:60.0pt;font-family:
  Arial;color:#333333'>H<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width=571 colspan=2 valign=top style='width:428.05pt;background:#D9D9D9;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:16.2pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
  24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Fractions</span></b><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
  normal'><span style='font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:1;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes;height:16.2pt'>
  <td width=285 style='width:214.0pt;background:silver;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
  height:16.2pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Input: </span></b><span
  style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
  style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=285 style='width:214.05pt;background:silver;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
  height:16.2pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
  style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'>You might find
it interesting that the digits 1, 2,
9 may be arranged to form two decimal
numbers whose ratio is <sub><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shapetype id="_x0000_t75"
 coordsize="21600,21600" o:spt="75" o:preferrelative="t" path="m@4@5l@4@11@9@11@9@5xe"
 filled="f" stroked="f">
 <v:stroke joinstyle="miter"/>
 <v:formulas>
  <v:f eqn="if lineDrawn pixelLineWidth 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 1 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum 0 0 @1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @2 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 0 1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @6 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @8 21600 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @10 21600 0"/>
 </v:formulas>
 <v:path o:extrusionok="f" gradientshapeok="t" o:connecttype="rect"/>
 <o:lock v:ext="edit" aspectratio="t"/>
</v:shapetype><v:shape id="_x0000_i1025" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:65.25pt;
 height:30.75pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/112/h_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=87 height=41
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/112/h_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1025"><![endif]></sub><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1025"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1246790084">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]-->. For example:</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:143.25pt'><sub><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape
 id="_x0000_i1026" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:54.75pt;height:30.75pt'
 o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/112/h_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=73 height=41
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/112/h_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1026"><![endif]></sub><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1026"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1246790085">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]-->, <sub><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id="_x0000_i1027" type="#_x0000_t75"
 style='width:54pt;height:30.75pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/112/h_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=72 height=41
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/112/h_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1027"><![endif]></sub><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1027"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1246790086">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]-->, 
, <sub><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id="_x0000_i1028"
 type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:56.25pt;height:30.75pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/112/h_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=75 height=41
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/112/h_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1028"><![endif]></sub><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1028"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1246790087">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]--></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:143.25pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'>This fact is
also true for most other number systems. So in general we can say that the
digits 1, 2, 
, D may be arranged to form two (D+1) based numbers whose ratio
is <sub><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape id="_x0000_i1029" type="#_x0000_t75"
 style='width:69pt;height:30.75pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/112/h_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=92 height=41
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/112/h_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1029"><![endif]></sub><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1029"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1246790088">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]-->. In this problem you will be asked to find such fractions.
In other words given the base B and denominator N you will have to find two
B-based integers P and Q (Both of them combined should use the digits 1, 2, 3,

, B-1 exactly once.) such that:</p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:143.25pt'><sub><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape
 id="_x0000_i1030" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:39pt;height:33pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/112/h_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=52 height=44
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/112/h_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1030"><![endif]></sub><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1030"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1246790089">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]--></p>

<h5 style='text-align:justify'><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>You can safely assume that the
digits larger than value 9 are represented by capital English letters starting
from A. So the digits of 12 based number system are 1, 2, 3, 4, 5,
6, 7, 8, 9, A, B (Zeros are not allowed in this problem).
Similarly, the digits of 27 based number system are 1, 2, 3,
, L, M,
N, O, P, Q. <o:p></o:p></span></span></h5>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h5 style='text-align:justify'><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Input</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h5>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The input file contains at most
300 lines of inputs. Each line contains two decimal integers B (1&lt;B&lt;28)
and N (1&lt;N&lt;B). </p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal>Input is terminated by a set where the value of B and N is
zero. This set should not be processed. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h4><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt'>Output <o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>For each set of input produce one
line of output. This line contains the two input values followed by two B-based
integers separated by a / (front slash). The two B-based integers denote the
values of P and Q respectively. So they actually denote the fraction <sub><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape
 id="_x0000_i1031" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:14.25pt;height:33pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/112/h_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=19 height=44
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/112/h_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1031"><![endif]></sub><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1031"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1246790090">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]-->. There will be no such inputs for which P and Q cannot be
found. If there is more than one solution any one of them will do.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal'>Sample
Input<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                            </span>Output
for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:
 solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=301 valign=top style='width:225.9pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>10
  2<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span
  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>10
  9<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span

  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span

  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><span

  </td>

  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span

  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span

  <p class=MsoNormal style='tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b><span

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'>

<body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='border-collapse:collapse;mso-yfti-tbllook:480;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;height:16.2pt'>
  <td width=103 rowspan=2 valign=top style='width:77.4pt;background:#E6E6E6;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:16.2pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-font-family:
  "Times New Roman";color:black;mso-ansi-language:EN-US;mso-fareast-language:
  EN-US;mso-bidi-language:AR-SA'><br clear=all style='page-break-before:always'>
  </span>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:60.0pt;font-family:
  Arial;color:#333333'>I<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width=571 colspan=2 valign=top style='width:428.05pt;background:#D9D9D9;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:16.2pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
  24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Take Me Home (To the Place I Belong)<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:1;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes;height:16.2pt'>
  <td width=285 style='width:214.0pt;background:silver;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
  height:16.2pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Input: </span></b><span
  style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
  style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=285 style='width:214.05pt;background:silver;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;
  height:16.2pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b
  style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
  10.0pt;font-family:Arial'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>At last, eminent scientist Safdar
Ali has decided to return to his beloved homeland <st1:country-region w:st="on">Bangladesh</st1:country-region>
after 16 years of exile in <st1:place w:st="on"><st1:country-region w:st="on">USA</st1:country-region></st1:place>.
As a scientist, he has many inventions and wants to bring back all those things
he invented with him. He has already arranged them in groups of different sizes
and wants some boxes to put them into and hand over the boxes to transport
company. So he asked a company named <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Pack-em-up Pvt. Ltd</i></b> to supply some
boxes. But the companys policy is little bit tricky. They offer <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>n</i></b>
different types of boxes, ranging from 1 to 1000000000 of various prices. For
each type of boxes they can supply as many as the customer asks. But for each
type of box, the company adds another <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>C</i></b> dollar with the total cost. So if
Safdar Ali wants 3 different types of boxes, he has to pay the price for each
box and extra <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>3*C</i></b> dollar. To minimize the cost, Safdar is willing to buy
larger boxes to fit smaller objects. So, Safdar Ali wants to buy the required
boxes with minimum cost.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h5 style='text-align:justify'><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Input</span></span><b><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></b></h5>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>There will be several test cases.
For each test case, the first line contains 3 numbers: C, M and N, where C (0&#8804;C&#8804;10000)
represents the extra cost that will be added for each type of boxes, M
(0&lt;M&lt;1001) represents the number of types of boxes offered by the <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>Pack-em-up</i></b>
Company, and N(0&lt;N&lt;1001) represents the number of types of boxes required
by Safdar Ali. After that there will be M lines, each containing two integers m<sub>i</sub>(0&lt;
m<sub>i</sub>&lt;100000001) and p<sub>i</sub>(0&lt; p<sub>i</sub>&lt;10001)
where m<sub>i</sub> represents the size of the boxes and p<sub>i</sub>
represents the price of each box of that size. Then there will be N lines each
containing 2 integer number n<sub>i</sub> (0&lt;n<sub>i</sub>&lt;100001)
(represents the size of the objects that is required to pack) and r<sub>i</sub>
n<sub>i</sub> (0&lt;r<sub>i</sub>&lt;1001) (which represents the number of
boxes that are required of that type). Input will be terminated when C=M=N=0.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h5 style='text-align:justify'><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt'>Output</span></span><b><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></b></h5>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>For each test case, there will be
one line of output. First print the test case number (see the sample output)
and then the minimum costs to pack all of the objects. If it is not possible to
pack, your output should be not possible.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal'>Sample
Input<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                              
</span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='background:#CCCCCC;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:
 solid windowtext .5pt;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=319 valign=top style='width:239.4pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>

  </td>
  <td width=348 valign=top style='width:261.0pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;

  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:

11253||||||false||||||
<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">

<head>
<meta http-equiv="content-type" content="text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1" />
<meta name="keywords" content="Tsinghua-HKUST Programming Contest 2007" />
<meta name="author" content="Cho" />
<title>Tsinghua-HKUST Programming Contest 2007: Problem A - Fractal</title>

<style type="text/css">
<!--
body { font-family: "Times New Roman"; font-size: 12pt; }
.io  { font-family: Courier New; font-size: 10pt }
-->
</style>
</head>

<body>
<center><span style='font-size:24pt'>Problem A - Fractal</span></center>
<br />
<br />

Define <i>r</i>(<i>s</i>) to be the complement of the reverse of the binary string <i>s</i>. i.e. Reverse <i>s</i> and then convert all 1's to 0's and all 0's to 1's. Further define a sequence of binary string as follow: <i>s</i><sub>0</sub> = 1 and <i>s</i><sub><i>n</i></sub> = <i>s</i><sub><i>n</i>-1</sub>1<i>r</i>(<i>s</i><sub><i>n</i>-1</sub>). i.e.<br />
<i>s</i><sub>0</sub> = 1<br />
<i>s</i><sub>1</sub> = 1<b>1</b>0<br />
<i>s</i><sub>2</sub> = 110<b>1</b>100<br />
<i>s</i><sub>3</sub> = 1101100<b>1</b>1100100<br />
...<br />
<br />
We then program a robot to move at a steady speed of 1 unit per second and make a right-angle turn according to the characters of <i>s</i><sub>10</sub> after every unit of movement. At the <i>k</i><sup>th</sup> turn, the robot turns to left if the <i>k</i><sup>th</sup> character of <i>s</i><sub>10</sub> is a 1, and to right otherwise. The figure below shows the whole path of the robot.<br />
<br />
<center><img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/112/p11253.gif"  alt="Path of s10" /></center><br />
<br />
The robot is placed at the origin (the small circle) and face east originally. It ends up at the coordinates (-32,32) (the small spot) after 2048 seconds. The path of the robot is known as a dragon curve, a pretty well-known pattern of fractal.<br />
<br />
If the robot is now programmed with input string <i>s</i><sub>30</sub> (with identical initial conditions as above), it will keep moving and then stop after 2<sup>31</sup> seconds. We want to know the location of the robot at any given time.<br />
<br />

<b>Input</b><br />
Input consists of multiple problem instances. Each instance consists of a single non-negative integer <i>n</i>, where <i>n</i> <span style='font-size:10pt'>&le;</span> 10<sup>9</sup>. The input data is terminated by a negative integer. There will be less than 5000 test cases.<br />
<br />

<b>Output</b><br />
For each input integer <i>n</i>, print out the location of the robot right after <i>n</i> second since the robot starts its journey with input string <i>s</i><sub>30</sub>. The location should be printed with the format &#8220;<span class="io">(x,y)</span>&#8221; in a single line.<br />
<br />

<b>Sample input</b><br />
<div class="io">
1<br />
2<br />
3<br />
2048<br />
1000000000<br />
-1<br />
</div>
<br />

<b>Sample output</b><br />
<div class="io">
(1,0)<br />
(1,1)<br />
(0,1)<br />
(-32,32)<br />
(9648,-31504)<br />
</div>
<br />

<hr size="1" />
Problem setter: Cho<br />
Source: Tsinghua-HKUST Programming Contest 2007<br />

</body>
</html>

______________________________________________________
11254||||||false||||||
<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">

<head>
<meta http-equiv="content-type" content="text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1" />
<meta name="keywords" content="Tsinghua-HKUST Programming Contest 2007" />
<meta name="author" content="Cho" />
<title>Tsinghua-HKUST Programming Contest 2007: Problem B - Consecutive Integers</title>

<style type="text/css">
<!--
body { font-family: "Times New Roman"; font-size: 12pt; }
.io  { font-family: Courier New; font-size: 10pt }
-->
</style>
</head>

<body>
<center><span style='font-size:24pt'>Problem B - Consecutive Integers</span></center>
<br />
<br />

Any positive integer can be written as the sum of several consecutive integers. For example,<br />
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="2">
<tr>
   <td>15</td>
   <td>=</td>
   <td>1 + ... + 5</td>
</tr>
<tr>
   <td></td>
   <td>=</td>
   <td>4 + ... + 6</td>
</tr>
<tr>
   <td></td>
   <td>=</td>
   <td>7 + ... + 8</td>
</tr>
<tr>
   <td></td>
   <td>=</td>
   <td>15 + ... + 15</td>
</tr>
</table>
<br />
Given a positive integer <i>n</i>, what are the consecutive positive integers with sum being <i>n</i>? If there are multiple solutions, which one consists of more numbers?<br />
<br />

<b>Input</b><br />
Input consists of multiple problem instances. Each instance consists of a single positive integer <i>n</i>, where <i>n</i> <span style='font-size:10pt'>&le;</span> 10<sup>9</sup>. The input data is terminated by a line containing -1. There will be at most 1000 test cases.<br />
<br />

<b>Output</b><br />
For each input integer <i>n</i>, print out the desired solution with the format:<br />
<span class="io">N = A + ... + B</span><br />
in a single line.<br />
(Read sample output for a clearer representation of the exact formatting.)<br />
<br />

<b>Sample input</b><br />
<div class="io">
8<br />
15<br />
35<br />
-1<br />
</div>
<br />

<b>Sample output</b><br />
<div class="io">
8 = 8 + ... + 8<br />
15 = 1 + ... + 5<br />
35 = 2 + ... + 8<br />
</div>
<br />

<hr size="1" />
Problem setter: Cho<br />
Source: Tsinghua-HKUST Programming Contest 2007<br />

</body>
</html>

______________________________________________________
11255||||||false||||||
<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">

<head>
<meta http-equiv="content-type" content="text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1" />
<meta name="keywords" content="Tsinghua-HKUST Programming Contest 2007" />
<meta name="author" content="Cho" />
<title>Tsinghua-HKUST Programming Contest 2007: Problem C - Necklace</title>

<style type="text/css">
<!--
body { font-family: "Times New Roman"; font-size: 12pt; }
.io  { font-family: Courier New; font-size: 10pt }
-->
</style>
</head>

<body>
<center><span style='font-size:24pt'>Problem C - Necklace</span></center>
<br />
<br />

Once upon a time, three girls - Winnie, Grace and Bonnie - owned a large number of pearls. However, each of them only had a single color of pearls. Winnie had white pearls, Grace had grey pearls and Bonnie had black pearls. One day, after a long discussion, they decided to make necklaces using the pearls. They are interested in knowing how many patterns can be formed using a certain number of pearls of each color, and have asked you to solve this problem for them.<br />
<br />
Note that rotating or flipping over a necklace cannot produce a different kind of necklace. i.e. The following figure shows three equivalent necklaces.<br />
<br />
<center><img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/112/p11255a.gif"  alt="Rotating and turning over a necklace" /></center><br />
<br />
The following figure shows all possible necklaces formed by 3 white pearls, 2 grey pearls and 1 black pearl.<br />
<br />
<center><img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/112/p11255a.gif"  alt="All necklaces formed by3 white pearls, 2 grey pearls and 1 black pearl" /></center><br />
<br />

<b>Input</b><br />
The input begins with an integer <i>N</i> (<span style='font-size:10pt'>&le;</span> 2500) which indicates the number of test cases followed. Each of the following test cases consists of three non-negative integers <i>a</i>, <i>b</i>, <i>c</i>, where 3 <span style='font-size:10pt'>&le;</span> <i>a</i> + <i>b</i> + <i>c</i> <span style='font-size:10pt'>&le;</span> 40.<br />
<br />

<b>Output</b><br />
For each test case, print out the number of different necklaces that formed by <i>a</i> white pearls, <i>b</i> grey pearls and <i>c</i> black pearls in a single line.<br />
<br />

<b>Sample input</b><br />
<div class="io">
2<br />
3 2 1<br />
2 2 2<br />
</div>
<br />

<b>Sample output</b><br />
<div class="io">
6<br />
11<br />
</div>
<br />

<hr size="1" />
Problem setter: Cho<br />
Special thanks: Michael (for making up the story)<br />
Source: Tsinghua-HKUST Programming Contest 2007<br />

</body>
</html>

______________________________________________________
11256||||||false||||||
<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">

<head>
<meta http-equiv="content-type" content="text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1" />
<meta name="keywords" content="Tsinghua-HKUST Programming Contest 2007" />
<meta name="author" content="Cho" />
<title>Tsinghua-HKUST Programming Contest 2007: Problem D - Repetitive Multiple</title>

<style type="text/css">
<!--
body { font-family: "Times New Roman"; font-size: 12pt; }
.io  { font-family: Courier New; font-size: 10pt }
-->
</style>
</head>

<body>
<center><span style='font-size:24pt'>Problem D - Repetitive Multiple</span></center>
<br />
<br />

An integer is said to be repetitive if it can be written as a concatenation of several copies (at least two) of another non-zero-leading integer. For example, 11, 123123, 454545 are all repetitive integers.<br />
<br />
Since zero-leading integers are not allowed, 101 can not be considered as 0101. Therefore, 101 is not repetitive.<br />
<br />
Given a positive integer <i>n</i>, what is the smallest repetitive integer which is a multiple of <i>n</i>.<br />
<br />

<b>Input</b><br />
The input begins with an integer <i>N</i> (<span style='font-size:10pt'>&le;</span> 100) which indicates the number of test cases followed. Each of the following test cases consists of a positive integer <i>n</i>, where <i>n</i> will be less than 10<sup>9</sup>.<br />
<br />

<b>Output</b><br />
For each test case, print out the smallest repetitive multiple of <i>n</i> in a single line.<br />
<br />

<b>Sample input</b><br />
<div class="io">
5<br />
7<br />
101<br />
123<br />
999999<br />
6339673<br />
</div>
<br />

<b>Sample output</b><br />
<div class="io">
77<br />
1010<br />
33333<br />
999999<br />
114114114<br />
</div>
<br />

<hr size="1" />
Problem setter: Cho<br />
Source: Tsinghua-HKUST Programming Contest 2007<br />

</body>
</html>

______________________________________________________
11257||||||false||||||
<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">

<head>
<meta http-equiv="content-type" content="text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1" />
<meta name="keywords" content="Tsinghua-HKUST Programming Contest 2007" />
<meta name="author" content="Cho" />
<title>Tsinghua-HKUST Programming Contest 2007: Problem E - New Marketing Plan</title>

<style type="text/css">
<!--
body { font-family: "Times New Roman"; font-size: 12pt; }
.io  { font-family: Courier New; font-size: 10pt }
-->
</style>
</head>

<body>
<center><span style='font-size:24pt'>Problem E - New Marketing Plan</span></center>
<br />
<br />

You work at a company that produces circular plates. In a meeting, your boss announces a new marketing plan - the company will package the plates in specially shaped containers, so as to attract customers' attention. The specially shaped containers will always be convex polygon. The existing packaging software can easily compute the maximum plate size for a given container size, but unfortunately, it can only do so for rectangular containers. Therefore, your boss asks you to write a program that can compute the maximum plate size given the container's shape.<br />
<br />
<center><img src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/112/p11257.gif"  alt="Maximum plate" /></center><br />
<br />
The above figure shows a maximum plate placed inside a convex-polygon-shaped container.<br />
<br />
Given the shape of a container, you need to compute the radius of the largest possible plate which can be fitted inside the container?<br />
<br />

<b>Input</b><br />
Input consists of multiple problem instances. Each instance begins with a single positive integer <i>n</i>, where 3 <span style='font-size:10pt'>&le;</span> <i>n</i> <span style='font-size:10pt'>&le;</span> 50. It is followed by 2<i>n</i> integers, <i>x</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>y</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>x</i><sub>2</sub>, <i>y</i><sub>2</sub>, ..., <i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>, <i>y</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>, where -1000 <span style='font-size:10pt'>&le;</span> <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, <i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> <span style='font-size:10pt'>&le;</span> 1000 for all <i>i</i>. They indicate the shape of a container which is a simple convex polygon with <i>n</i> vertices (<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>y</i><sub>1</sub>), (<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>, <i>y</i><sub>2</sub>), ..., (<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>, <i>y</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>) in counter-clockwise order. The area of the polygon is guaranteed to be positive and no three consecutive vertices are collinear. The input data is terminated by an <i>n</i> being 0. There will not be more than 100 test cases.<br />
<br />

<b>Output</b><br />
For each test case, print out the radius of the largest possible plate which can be fitted inside the input container. The answer should be printed with 3 digits after the decimal point in a single line.<br />
<br />

<b>Sample input</b><br />
<div class="io">
5<br />
5 5 -3 4 -7 -2 2 -4 6 -1<br />
3<br />
0 0 10 0 0 10<br />
0<br />
</div>
<br />

<b>Sample output</b><br />
<div class="io">
4.082<br />
2.929<br />
</div>
<br />

<hr size="1" />
Problem setter: Cho<br />
Special thanks: Michael (for making up the story)<br />
Source: Tsinghua-HKUST Programming Contest 2007<br />

</body>
</html>

______________________________________________________
11258||||||false||||||
<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">

<head>
<meta http-equiv="content-type" content="text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1" />
<meta name="keywords" content="Tsinghua-HKUST Programming Contest 2007" />
<meta name="author" content="Cho" />
<title>Tsinghua-HKUST Programming Contest 2007: Problem F - String Partition</title>

<style type="text/css">
<!--
body { font-family: "Times New Roman"; font-size: 12pt; }
.io  { font-family: Courier New; font-size: 10pt }
-->
</style>
</head>

<body>
<center><span style='font-size:24pt'>Problem F - String Partition</span></center>
<br />
<br />

John was absurdly busy for preparing a programming contest recently. He wanted to create a ridiculously easy problem for the contest. His problem was not only easy, but also boring: Given a list of non-negative integers, what is the sum of them?<br />
<br />
However, he made a very typical mistake when he wrote a program to generate the input data for his problem. He forgot to print out spaces to separate the list of integers. John quickly realized his mistake after looking at the generated input file because each line is simply a string of digits instead of a list of integers.<br />
<br />
He then got a better idea to make his problem a little more interesting: There are many ways to split a string of digits into a list of non-zero-leading (0 itself is allowed) 32-bit <i>signed</i> integers. What is the maximum sum of the resultant integers if the string is split appropriately?<br />
<br />

<b>Input</b><br />
The input begins with an integer <i>N</i> (<span style='font-size:10pt'>&le;</span> 500) which indicates the number of test cases followed. Each of the following test cases consists of a string of at most 200 digits.<br />
<br />

<b>Output</b><br />
For each input, print out required answer in a single line.<br />
<br />

<b>Sample input</b><br />
<div class="io">
6<br />
1234554321<br />
5432112345<br />
000<br />
121212121212<br />
2147483648<br />
11111111111111111111111111111111111111111111111111111<br />
</div>
<br />

<b>Sample output</b><br />
<div class="io">
1234554321<br />
543211239<br />
0<br />
2121212124<br />
214748372<br />
5555555666<br />
</div>
<br />

<hr size="1" />
Problem setter: Cho<br />
Source: Tsinghua-HKUST Programming Contest 2007<br />

</body>
</html>

______________________________________________________
11259||||||false||||||
<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-transitional.dtd">
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">

<head>
<meta http-equiv="content-type" content="text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1" />
<meta name="keywords" content="Tsinghua-HKUST Programming Contest 2007" />
<meta name="author" content="Cho" />
<title>Tsinghua-HKUST Programming Contest 2007: Problem G - Coin Changing Again</title>

<style type="text/css">
<!--
body { font-family: "Times New Roman"; font-size: 12pt; }
.io  { font-family: Courier New; font-size: 10pt }
-->
</style>
</head>

<body>
<center><span style='font-size:24pt'>Problem G - Coin Changing Again</span></center>
<br />
<br />

There are four types of coins with value <i>c</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>c</i><sub>2</sub>, <i>c</i><sub>3</sub> and <i>c</i><sub>4</sub>, and there are only <i>d</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>d</i><sub>2</sub>, <i>d</i><sub>3</sub> and <i>d</i><sub>4</sub> number of these coins respectively. How many ways are there to obtain a value <i>v</i> by adding up these coins?<br />
<br />
For example, if you have 3 $1-coins, 2 $2-coins, 3 $5-coins, 1 $10-coin, there are 4 ways to obtain $10 from those coins:<br />
10 = 1 + 1 + 1 + 2 + 5<br />
10 = 1 + 2 + 2 + 5<br />
10 = 5 + 5<br />
10 = 10<br />
<br />

<b>Input</b><br />
The input begins with an integer <i>N</i> (<span style='font-size:10pt'>&le;</span> 100) which indicates the number of test cases followed. Each of the following test cases begins with five positive integers <i>c</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>c</i><sub>2</sub>, <i>c</i><sub>3</sub>, <i>c</i><sub>4</sub>, <i>q</i>, where 1 <span style='font-size:10pt'>&le;</span> <i>c</i><sub>1</sub> &lt; <i>c</i><sub>2</sub> &lt; <i>c</i><sub>3</sub> &lt; <i>c</i><sub>4</sub> <span style='font-size:10pt'>&le;</span> 1000 and <i>q</i> <span style='font-size:10pt'>&le;</span> 100. It is then followed by <i>q</i> queries. Each query consists of 5 integers, <i>d</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>d</i><sub>2</sub>, <i>d</i><sub>3</sub>, <i>d</i><sub>4</sub>, <i>v</i>, where 1 <span style='font-size:10pt'>&le;</span> <i>d</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>d</i><sub>2</sub>, <i>d</i><sub>3</sub>, <i>d</i><sub>4</sub>, <i>v</i> <span style='font-size:10pt'>&le;</span> 10<sup>5</sup>.<br />
<br />

<b>Output</b><br />
For each query from each test case, print out the number of way to obtain <i>v</i> by adding up <i>d</i><sub>1</sub> <i>c</i><sub>1</sub>-coins, <i>d</i><sub>2</sub> <i>c</i><sub>2</sub>-coins, <i>d</i><sub>3</sub> <i>c</i><sub>3</sub>-coins and <i>d</i><sub>4</sub> <i>c</i><sub>4</sub>-coins in a single line.<br />
<br />

<b>Sample input</b><br />
<div class="io">
2<br />
1 2 5 10 2<br />
3 2 3 1 10<br />
1000 2 2 2 900<br />
10 20 30 40 1<br />
100 100 100 100 101<br />
</div>
<br />

<b>Sample output</b><br />
<div class="io">
4<br />
27<br />
0<br />
</div>
<br />

<hr size="1" />
Problem setter: Cho<br />
Source: Tsinghua-HKUST Programming Contest 2007<br />

</body>
</html>

______________________________________________________
11260||||||false||||||

<title>Problem E - Contemplation! Algebra</title>

<body lang=EN-US link="#6633CC" vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem A</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Odd Root Sum</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h5 style='text-align:justify'><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></span></h5>

<h5 style='text-align:justify'><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Given the value of an n you will
have to find the modulo 100000000 value of the following expression:<o:p></o:p></span></span></h5>

<h5 style='text-align:justify'><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></span></h5>

<h5 style='text-align:justify'><span class=StyleArial16pt><sub><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-weight:normal;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shapetype id="_x0000_t75"
 coordsize="21600,21600" o:spt="75" o:preferrelative="t" path="m@4@5l@4@11@9@11@9@5xe"
 filled="f" stroked="f">
 <v:stroke joinstyle="miter"/>
 <v:formulas>
  <v:f eqn="if lineDrawn pixelLineWidth 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 1 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum 0 0 @1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @2 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 0 1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @6 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @8 21600 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @10 21600 0"/>
 </v:formulas>
 <v:path o:extrusionok="f" gradientshapeok="t" o:connecttype="rect"/>
 <o:lock v:ext="edit" aspectratio="t"/>
</v:shapetype><v:shape id="_x0000_i1026" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:298.5pt;
 height:27pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/112/a_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=398 height=36
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/112/a_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1026"><![endif]></span></sub></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1026"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1249894519">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]-->, where m is the largest odd number not greater than n<o:p></o:p></span></span></h5>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Or in other words you will have
to find the value of S where,</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><sub><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shape
 id="_x0000_i1027" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:363pt;height:28.5pt' o:ole=" >
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/112/a_files/image001.wmz"  o:title=" />
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=484 height=38
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/112/a_files/image001.wmz"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1027"><![endif]></sub><!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:OLEObject Type="Embed" ProgID="Equation.3" ShapeID="_x0000_i1027"
  DrawAspect="Content" ObjectID="_1249894520">
 </o:OLEObject>
</xml><![endif]-->.<span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:
12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";font-weight:
normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h5 style='text-align:justify'><span class=StyleArial16pt><span
style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Input</span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Arial Unicode MS"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h5>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The input file contains at most 30000
lines of inputs. Each line contains a single 64-nit signed integer which
denotes the value of n. Input is terminated by a line containing a single zero
which should not b processed.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h4><span class=StyleArial16pt><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
10.0pt;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Output </span></span><span
class=StyleArial16pt><span style='mso-ansi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h4>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>For each line of input produce one
line of output. This line contains the value of S. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:143.25pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<h1 align=left style='text-align:left'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;font-style:normal'>Sample
Input<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>                            </span><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>   </span>Output for Sample Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></h1>

  style='font-size:11.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>9<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-layout-grid-align:none;text-autospace:none'><b><span

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b>Problemsetter:
</b>Shahriar Manzoor</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><b>Special
Thanks To: </b>Derek Kisman</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

</div>

<html xmlns:v="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:vml"
xmlns:o="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:office"
xmlns:w="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:word"
xmlns="http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40">

<meta http-equiv=Content-Type content="text/html; charset=windows-1252">
<meta name=ProgId content=Word.Document>

<meta name=Originator content="Microsoft Word 11">
<link rel=File-List href="b_files/filelist.xml">
<link rel=Edit-Time-Data href="b_files/editdata.mso">
<!--[if !mso]>
<style>
v\:* {behavior:url(#default#VML);}
o\:* {behavior:url(#default#VML);}
w\:* {behavior:url(#default#VML);}
.shape {behavior:url(#default#VML);}

<title>Bishops</title>
<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
 <o:DocumentProperties>
  <o:Author>Mahmudur Rahman</o:Author>
  <o:LastAuthor>Shahriar Manzoor</o:LastAuthor>

 </o:DocumentProperties>

<!--[if gte mso 10]>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem B</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b><span style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Bishops</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Little Sultan has a new chess
set. But he finds it more amusing to make some new variants of his own than the
original game of chess. Here he challenges you with one of his new variants. On
a <b>n×n</b> chessboard <b>m</b> bishops are placed. You have to calculate how
many square cells of the chessboard are not attacked by any of those bishops. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b>Input<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>On the first line you will be
given <b>L</b> which denotes the number of input sets you have to process. For
each of the input sets, you will have the following:</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b>n, m</b> on a line.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Each of the following <b>m</b>
lines will have two integers: <b>r_i</b> and <b>c_i</b> denoting the row and
column position of the bishops (1-based). </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b>Output<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>For each input set, output the
set number as the sample output suggests and the number of cells which are not
attacked by any of the bishops. </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b>Constraints<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>1. 1 &lt;= n &lt;= 40000</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>2. 0 &lt;= m &lt;= 10000</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>3. The positions for the bishops
will be distinct.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>4. 1 &lt;= r_i, c_i &lt;= n </p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<table class=MsoTableGrid border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width=621
 style='width:465.4pt;border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
 mso-yfti-tbllook:480;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;mso-border-insideh:
 .5pt solid windowtext;mso-border-insidev:.5pt solid windowtext'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;height:24.4pt'>
  <td width=310 valign=top style='width:232.7pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:24.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b>Sample Input<o:p></o:p></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width=310 valign=top style='width:232.7pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:
  solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:24.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b>Sample Output<o:p></o:p></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:1;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes;height:83.85pt'>
  <td width=310 valign=top style='width:232.7pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-top:none;mso-border-top-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:83.85pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>2</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>1 1</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>1 1</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>2 1</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>2 1</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>
  </td>
  <td width=310 valign=top style='width:232.7pt;border-top:none;border-left:
  none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-right:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-top-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:83.85pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Case #1: 0</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Case #2: 2</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></b></p>

<title>Problem C</title>
<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>

 <o:shapelayout v:ext="edit">
  <o:idmap v:ext="edit" data="1"/>
 </o:shapelayout></xml><![endif]-->
</head>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem C</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b><span style='font-size:20.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Weird Fence</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>In the land of our great Sultan,
the World Weird Fence (WWF) festival is going to take place again. For the
festival, some poles are set up in a Cartesian plane. Each pole is colored in either
red or blue color. You can connect two poles with a chain that consists of
multi-colored rings thus creating a weird fence. Each pole has a single hook so
you can not connect more than one chain to a pole. Now, though you have an
unlimited supply of chains all having the same length, its important to note
that each of the chains has a red ring at one end &amp; a blue ring at the
other end and you are only allowed to hook up a ring to a pole with same color.
Also, its obvious that you can use a chain to connect two poles if &amp; only
if the chains length is greater than or equal to the linear distance of those
two poles.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><!--[if gte vml 1]><v:shapetype
 id="_x0000_t75" coordsize="21600,21600" o:spt="75" o:preferrelative="t"
 path="m@4@5l@4@11@9@11@9@5xe" filled="f" stroked="f">
 <v:stroke joinstyle="miter"/>
 <v:formulas>
  <v:f eqn="if lineDrawn pixelLineWidth 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 1 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum 0 0 @1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @2 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @3 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @0 0 1"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @6 1 2"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelWidth"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @8 21600 0"/>
  <v:f eqn="prod @7 21600 pixelHeight"/>
  <v:f eqn="sum @10 21600 0"/>
 </v:formulas>
 <v:path o:extrusionok="f" gradientshapeok="t" o:connecttype="rect"/>
 <o:lock v:ext="edit" aspectratio="t"/>
</v:shapetype><v:shape id="_x0000_i1026" type="#_x0000_t75" style='width:165pt;
 height:120pt'>
 <v:imagedata src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/112/c_files/image001.jpg"  o:title="Lines"/>
</v:shape><![endif]--><![if !vml]><img width=220 height=160
src="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/112/c_files/image001.jpg"  v:shapes="_x0000_i1026"><![endif]></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Given the co-ordinates of the
poles &amp; a positive integer <b>k</b>, write a program to find the minimum
possible integer length for the chains so that at least <b>k</b> weird fences
can be made. The fences may cross each other.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b>Input<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>The first line of the input file
is the number of test cases <b>N</b>. This line will be followed by a blank
line. <b>N</b> test cases follow. First line of each test case contains two
positive integers <b>P</b> &amp; <b>k</b> where <b>P</b> is the number of poles
on the plane. (<b>1&lt;=P,k&lt;=100</b>). Each of the next <b>P </b>lines has
two integers <b>X</b> &amp; <b>Y</b> &amp; the word <b>red</b> / <b>blue</b>.
<b>X</b> &amp; <b>Y</b> are the co-ordinates of the pole (<b>-1000&lt;=X,Y&lt;=1000</b>)
&amp; the word is the color of that pole. No two poles will be in the same
location. There will be a blank line between test cases.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b>Output<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>For each test case output a
single integer in a line which is the minimum integer length of the chains that
is necessary to make at least <b>k</b> fences. If it is not possible to build <b>k</b>
fences with the given constraints, print the word <b>Impossible</b> in a
single line.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></b></p>

<table class=MsoTableGrid border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='border-collapse:collapse;border:none;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
 mso-yfti-tbllook:480;mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;mso-border-insideh:
 .5pt solid windowtext;mso-border-insidev:.5pt solid windowtext'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;height:13.65pt'>
  <td width=304 valign=top style='width:228.15pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:13.65pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b>Sample Input<o:p></o:p></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width=304 valign=top style='width:228.15pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-left:none;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:
  solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:13.65pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b>Sample Output<o:p></o:p></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:1;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes;height:251.85pt'>
  <td width=304 valign=top style='width:228.15pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-top:none;mso-border-top-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:251.85pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>2</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>6 2</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>-3 5 blue</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>-3 3 red</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>1 5 blue</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>2 0 red</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>4 6 blue</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>4 -1 red</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>6 4</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>-3 5 blue</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>-3 3 red</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>1 5 blue</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>2 0 red</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>4 6 blue</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>4 -1 red</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>
  </td>
  <td width=304 valign=top style='width:228.15pt;border-top:none;border-left:
  none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-right:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  mso-border-top-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;mso-border-left-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;
  mso-border-alt:solid windowtext .5pt;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt;height:251.85pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>6</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Impossible</p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>
  </td>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
Arial'>Problem D</span></b><span style='font-family:Arial'><br>
</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:20.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:24.0pt;font-family:Arial'>Nested Rectangles</span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial'><br>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>Input: </b><span style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>Standard Input<o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:Arial'>Output: </span></b><span
style='font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>Standard Output <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>Sultan has a rectangle of <b>R</b>
rows and <b>C</b> columns. Each cell of this rectangle contains an integer. Sultan
chooses n subrectangles. The ith subrectangle has <b>Ri</b> rows and <b>Ci</b>
columns and it is nested inside (i-1)th subrectangle. The first subrectangle
is nested inside the initial rectangle. Sultan then multiplies all the integers
outside the first subrectangle with <b>M<sub>0</sub></b>. Then he multiplies
all the integers inside ith rectangle but outside (i+1)th rectangle with <b>M<sub>i</sub></b>.
Then he multiples all the integers inside nth subrectangle with <b>M<sub>n</sub></b>.
So he get a new rectangle of integers. The sum of all the integers of this new
rectangle is <b>S</b>. Help Sultan to choose all this subrectangles in such a
way so that <b>S</b> is maximized.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<div align=center>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width=488
 style='width:366.0pt;border-collapse:collapse;mso-padding-alt:0in 0in 0in 0in'>

  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;
  font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>
  </td>

  </td>
 </tr>

  </td>

  </td>
  <td nowrap valign=bottom style='padding:.75pt .75pt 0in .75pt;height:21.75pt'>

  </td>
  <td nowrap valign=bottom style='border:none;border-right:solid windowtext 1.5pt;

  font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>-1<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>

  <td nowrap valign=bottom style='padding:.75pt .75pt 0in .75pt;height:21.0pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;
  font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td nowrap valign=bottom style='border:none;border-left:solid windowtext 1.5pt;
  padding:.75pt .75pt 0in .75pt;height:21.0pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
  font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>-1<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td nowrap valign=bottom style='border:none;border-left:solid windowtext 1.5pt;
  padding:.75pt .75pt 0in .75pt;height:21.0pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
  font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>2<o:p></o:p></span></p>

 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:7;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes;height:13.5pt'>
  <td nowrap colspan=7 valign=bottom style='padding:.75pt .75pt 0in .75pt;
  height:13.5pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><span
  style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:Arial;mso-bidi-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>In the above figure, the outer
most portion (that is not contained in any of the sub rectangle) is multiplied
by <b>M<sub>0</sub></b>, the portion inside the first rectangle, but outside
the second one by <b>M<sub>1</sub></b>, portion inside 2<sup>nd</sup> and
outside 3<sup>rd</sup> by <b>M<sub>2</sub></b>, and so forth. The portion
inside the N th sub rectangle is multiplied by <b>M<sub>n</sub></b>.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b>Input:<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>First line of the input contains <b>T(&#8804;20)</b>
the number of test cases. First line of the each test case contains 3 integers <b>R(1&#8804;R&#8804;500),C(1&#8804;C&#8804;500)</b>
and <b>n(1&#8804;n&#8804;5)</b>. Second line contains <b>n</b> integers <b>R<sub>1</sub>,R<sub>2</sub>....,R<sub>n</sub>(R&gt;
R<sub>1&gt;</sub>R<sub>2</sub>&gt;...&gt;R<sub>n</sub>)</b>. Third line
contains <b>n</b> integers <b>C<sub>1</sub>,C<sub>2</sub>,....,C<sub>n</sub>(C&gt;
C<sub>1</sub>&gt;C<sub>2</sub>&gt;...&gt;C<sub>n</sub>)</b>. The values <b>R<sub>i</sub></b>,
<b>C<sub>i</sub></b> describes the dimensions of the i<sup>th</sup> sub
rectangle. Fourth line contains <b>n+1</b> integers <b>M<sub>0</sub>,M<sub>1</sub>,...,M<sub>n
</sub>(-10&#8804;M<sub>i</sub>&#8804;10), </b>the values of each multiplier. Lines
5 to line 4+R each contain <b>C</b> integers. The j<sup>th</sup> integer in the
(i+4)<sup>th</sup> line is the number in the i<sup>th</sup> row and j<sup>th</sup>
column of the initial rectangle. All the integers in the initial rectangle is
between -100 to +100 inclusive.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b>Output:<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'>For each test case output
contains one integer denoting the maximum value of <b>S</b>.</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

<span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-family:Vrinda;mso-ansi-language:EN-US;
mso-fareast-language:EN-US;mso-bidi-language:#0845'><br clear=all
style='mso-special-character:line-break;page-break-before:always'>
</span>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

Rahman Khan</p>

<!--[if gte mso 9]><xml>
