<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="100%"
 style='width:100.0%;mso-cellspacing:0in;border:outset 1.5pt;mso-yfti-tbllook:
 1184;mso-padding-alt:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
  <table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="100%"
   style='width:100.0%;mso-cellspacing:0in;background:#D9D9D9;border:solid white 1.5pt;
   mso-yfti-tbllook:1184;mso-padding-alt:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
   <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;height:19.5pt'>
    <td width="20%" rowspan=2 style='width:20.0%;border:solid white 1.5pt;
    padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;height:19.5pt'>
    <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;line-height:normal'><b><span
    style='font-size:48.0pt;font-family:"Garamond","serif"'>F</span></b></p>
    </td>
    <td width="56%" style='width:56.04%;border:solid white 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;
    height:19.5pt'>
    <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;line-height:normal'><span
    style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Algerian'>Next generation contest - 4</span></p>
    </td>
    <td width="23%" rowspan=2 style='width:23.96%;border:solid white 1.5pt;
    padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;height:19.5pt'>
    <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;line-height:normal'><b
    style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
    font-family:"Garamond","serif"'>Time Limit  5 secs</span><o:p></o:p></b></p>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:1;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
    <td width="56%" valign=bottom style='width:56.04%;border:solid white 1.5pt;
    padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
    <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;line-height:normal'><b><span
    style='font-size:28.0pt;font-family:"Garamond","serif"'>Faster Processing
    Feasibility</span></b></p>
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt'>&nbsp;</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>The era of technology
is so hectic at times! Each &amp; every single day, the crying needs for faster
&amp; faster processors are becoming more important than before with the
continuously increasing complexity of applications &amp; tasks. One of the
solutions that the processor manufacturers are successfully employing nowadays
is parallel processing. Scheduling of tasks is a prime concern while designing
faster processors having several components working in parallel. We are
currently building a new microprocessor that has <b>P</b> logical
sub-processors in it. Each of the logical sub-processors can act as an
individual processor &amp; process one of the available tasks during a time
slot. Note that, a logical sub-processor can process only a single task in one
time slot &amp; a task can not be processed by more than one processor during a
time slot. Now, you are given the arrival time (the time when a task becomes
available to the processors), processing time (the number of time slots
necessary to complete processing the task) &amp; deadline (the earliest time
when the processing of this task is required to be completed) for <b>T </b>tasks.
You have to figure out if it is possible to schedule the tasks using the
available resources in such a way that all tasks are completed before their
respective deadlines. </span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>Let us be a bit more
specific. From now on we shall assume, each time slot equals 1 micro-second.
The span of the first time slot is 0 to 1 micro-second while the second time
slot is 1 to 2 micro-second &amp; so on.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>For example, consider a
multi-processor system with 2 logical sub-processors. You are needed to
schedule 3 tasks A, B &amp; C with the following data.</span></p>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='border-collapse:collapse;mso-yfti-tbllook:1184;mso-padding-alt:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes'>
  <td width=142 valign=top style='width:106.55pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;line-height:11.0pt'><i>Task</i></p>
  </td>
  <td width=142 valign=top style='width:106.55pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-left:none;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;line-height:11.0pt'><i>Arrival
  Time</i></p>
  </td>
  <td width=142 valign=top style='width:106.55pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-left:none;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;line-height:11.0pt'><i>Processing
  Time</i></p>
  </td>
  <td width=142 valign=top style='width:106.6pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-left:none;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;line-height:11.0pt'><i>Deadline</i></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:1'>
  <td width=142 valign=top style='width:106.55pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-top:none;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;line-height:11.0pt'>A</p>
  </td>
  <td width=142 valign=top style='width:106.55pt;border-top:none;border-left:
  none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-right:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;line-height:11.0pt'>0</p>
  </td>
  <td width=142 valign=top style='width:106.55pt;border-top:none;border-left:
  none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-right:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;line-height:11.0pt'>2</p>
  </td>
  <td width=142 valign=top style='width:106.6pt;border-top:none;border-left:
  none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-right:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;line-height:11.0pt'>2</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:2'>
  <td width=142 valign=top style='width:106.55pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-top:none;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;line-height:11.0pt'>B</p>
  </td>
  <td width=142 valign=top style='width:106.55pt;border-top:none;border-left:
  none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-right:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;line-height:11.0pt'>0</p>
  </td>
  <td width=142 valign=top style='width:106.55pt;border-top:none;border-left:
  none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-right:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;line-height:11.0pt'>3</p>
  </td>
  <td width=142 valign=top style='width:106.6pt;border-top:none;border-left:
  none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-right:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;line-height:11.0pt'>4</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:3;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td width=142 valign=top style='width:106.55pt;border:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  border-top:none;padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;line-height:11.0pt'>C</p>
  </td>
  <td width=142 valign=top style='width:106.55pt;border-top:none;border-left:
  none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-right:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;line-height:11.0pt'>1</p>
  </td>
  <td width=142 valign=top style='width:106.55pt;border-top:none;border-left:
  none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-right:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;line-height:11.0pt'>2</p>
  </td>
  <td width=142 valign=top style='width:106.6pt;border-top:none;border-left:
  none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-right:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
  padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center;line-height:11.0pt'>3</p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>&nbsp;</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>It is possible to
schedule these 3 tasks in the given system so that all the tasks meet their
respective deadlines i.e. processing of task A, B &amp; C are completed at (or
before) time 2 micro-second, 4 micro-second &amp; 3 micro-second respectively.
Look at the following table for a possible schedule.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:11.0pt'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:11.0pt'>&nbsp;</p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
line-height:115%;font-family:"Garamond","serif"'>&nbsp;</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
line-height:115%;font-family:"Garamond","serif"'>Input</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>The first line of the
input is the number of test cases </span><b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
line-height:115%;font-family:"Courier New"'>C</span></b><span style='font-size:
12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'> (1 &#8804; </span><b><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Courier New"'>C</span></b><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>
&#8804; 50 ). </span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:
"Courier New"'>C</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;
font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'> test cases follow. A test case begins
with 2 integers </span><b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;
font-family:"Courier New"'>P</span></b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'> (1 &#8804; </span><b><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Courier New"'>P</span></b><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>
&#8804; 40) &amp; </span><b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;
font-family:"Courier New"'>T</span></b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>(1 &#8804; </span><b><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Courier New"'>T</span></b><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>
&#8804; 40), as described earlier. Each of the next </span><b><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Courier New"'>T</span></b><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>
lines gives a task detail. A task detail consists of 3 integers  arrival time,
</span><b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Courier New"'>A<sub>i</sub></span></b><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>
(0 &#8804; </span><b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:
"Courier New"'>A<sub>i</sub></span></b><sub><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'> </span></sub><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>&#8804;
1000), processing time, </span><b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:
115%;font-family:"Courier New"'>R<sub>i</sub></span></b><span style='font-size:
12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'> (1 &#8804; </span><b><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Courier New"'>R<sub>i</sub></span></b><sub><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>
</span></sub><span style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>&#8804;
5000) &amp; deadline, </span><b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;
font-family:"Courier New"'>D<sub>i</sub></span></b><sub><span style='font-size:
12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'> </span></sub><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>(</span><b><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Courier New"'>A<sub>i</sub></span></b><sub><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>
</span></sub><span style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>+
</span><b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Courier New"'>R<sub>i</sub></span></b><sub><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>
</span></sub><span style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>&nbsp;&#8804;
</span><b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Courier New"'>D<sub>i</sub></span></b><sub><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>&nbsp;
</span></sub><span style='font-size:12.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>&#8804;
10000). <sub>&nbsp;</sub></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
line-height:115%;font-family:"Garamond","serif"'>Output</span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>For each test case,
print FEASIBLE in a line if there is a possible schedule to meet all the
deadlines. Otherwise, print NO WAY.</span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
line-height:115%'>&nbsp;</span></p>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='mso-cellspacing:0in;mso-yfti-tbllook:1184;mso-padding-alt:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes'>
  <td width=226 valign=top style='width:169.45pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><b><span
  style='font-size:16.0pt;font-family:"Garamond","serif"'>Sample Input</span></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width=352 valign=top style='width:264.05pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><b><span
  style='font-size:16.0pt;font-family:"Garamond","serif"'>Output for Sample
  Input</span></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:1;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes;height:63.15pt'>
  <td width=226 valign=top style='width:169.45pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;
  height:63.15pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='line-height:11.0pt'><span style='font-family:"Courier New"'>2<br>
  2 3<br>
  0 2 2<br>
  0 3 4<br>
  1 2 3<br>
  2 3<br>
  0 2 2<br>
  0 3 3<br>
  1 2 3</span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;line-height:
  normal'><span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>&nbsp;</span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=352 valign=top style='width:264.05pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;
  height:63.15pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='line-height:11.0pt'><span style='font-family:"Courier New"'>FEASIBLE<br>
  NO WAY </span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<div style='border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0in 0in 1.0pt 0in'>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><b><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>&nbsp;</span></b></p>

</div>

"Garamond","serif"'>ProblemSetter: Mohammad Mahmudur Rahman<br>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="100%"
 style='width:100.0%;mso-cellspacing:0in;border:outset 1.5pt;mso-yfti-tbllook:
 1184;mso-padding-alt:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
  <table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="100%"
   style='width:100.0%;mso-cellspacing:0in;background:#D9D9D9;border:solid white 1.5pt;
   mso-yfti-tbllook:1184;mso-padding-alt:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
   <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;height:19.5pt'>
    <td width="18%" rowspan=2 style='width:18.16%;border:solid white 1.5pt;
    padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;height:19.5pt'>
    <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:
    auto;text-align:center;line-height:normal'><b><span style='font-size:48.0pt;
    font-family:"Garamond","serif"'>G</span></b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
    font-family:"Garamond","serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
    </td>
    <td width="60%" style='width:60.78%;border:solid white 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;
    height:19.5pt'>
    <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:
    auto;text-align:center;line-height:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
    font-family:Algerian'>NEXT generation contest - 4<o:p></o:p></span></p>
    </td>
    <td width="21%" rowspan=2 style='width:21.06%;border:solid white 1.5pt;
    padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;height:19.5pt'>
    <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:
    auto;text-align:center;line-height:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
    font-family:"Garamond","serif"'>Time Limit  5 <span class=SpellE>secs</span><o:p></o:p></span></p>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:1;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
    <td width="60%" valign=bottom style='width:60.78%;border:solid white 1.5pt;
    padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
    <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:
    auto;text-align:center;line-height:normal'><b><span style='font-size:26.0pt;
    mso-bidi-font-size:28.0pt;font-family:"Garamond","serif"'>Guards, Imbecile
    Guards</span></b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;line-height:
  normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>You
have a square maze of size </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>N</span></b><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>
x </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>N</span></b><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>.
You begin from a source cell and start your journey in hope of reaching the
target cell in minimum number of moves. You can move to new cell if it shares
an edge with the current cell you are standing on. The minimum moves required
arent always the <st1:City w:st="on"><st1:place w:st="on">Manhattan</st1:place></st1:City>
distance as there are few obstacles placed on certain places of the maze. You
have to avoid those obstacles in your path. In addition to the obstacles, there
are more impediments in the form of <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>guards</i>.
The guards, however, arent that clever and they are also short-sighted. Initially
every guard monotonously walks to the right. If it encounters an obstacle or
reaches the end of the maze (last column) it turns left and starts walking. It
walks left until it reaches an obstacle or the end (first column) when it
changes direction to the right and starts walking. Every guard moves 1 cell per
unit time. Your speed is also 1 cell per unit time. In every unit time, you can
either make a move or stay in the same position. Staying in the same position
also counts as a move.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>You
are caught by a guard if both of you land on the same cell at the same time or
if you bump into each other during a move. In the latter case, you are caught
in between the cells.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>Every
cell of the maze will be represented by one of the following:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Courier New"'>S  Starting Cell. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Courier New"'>T  Target Cell.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Courier New"'># - An Obstacle<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Courier New"'>X  A Guard<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Courier New"'>.  An Empty Cell<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>There
will be at most 3 guards in a maze and all of them will be situated in
different rows.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>An
example of the movement of a guard for first 6 seconds of its locomotion:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Courier New"'>......<span style='mso-tab-count:1'>     </span>......<span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>     </span>......<span style='mso-tab-count:1'>     </span>......<span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>     </span>......<span style='mso-tab-count:1'>     </span>......<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>    </span>......<br>
......<span style='mso-tab-count:1'>     </span>......<span style='mso-tab-count:
1'>     </span>......<span style='mso-tab-count:1'>     </span>......<span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>     </span>......<span style='mso-tab-count:1'>     </span>......<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>    </span>......<br>
.#.X<span class=GramE>..</span><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>     </span>.#..X.<span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>     </span><span class=GramE>.#</span>...X<span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>     </span>.#..X.<span style='mso-tab-count:1'>     </span><span
class=GramE>.#</span>.X..<span style='mso-tab-count:1'>     </span><span
class=GramE>.#</span>X...<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>    </span>.#.X<span
class=GramE>..</span><br>
<span class=GramE>......<span style='mso-tab-count:1'>     </span>......<span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>     </span>......<span style='mso-tab-count:1'>     </span>......<span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>     </span>......<span style='mso-tab-count:1'>     </span>......<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>    </span>......</span><br>
<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>0<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>          </span>1<span style='mso-tab-count:1'>  </span><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>        </span>2<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>          </span>3<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>         </span>4<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>          </span>5<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>          </span>6<span style='mso-tab-count:1'> </span></b><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>     </span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
11.0pt;font-family:"Garamond","serif"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
11.0pt;font-family:"Garamond","serif"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
11.0pt;font-family:"Garamond","serif"'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>The
input file starts with an integer </span><span class=GramE><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
"Courier New"'>T</span></b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>(</span></span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>T</span></b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>&lt;50) that
indicates the number of test cases. Each case starts with a positive integer </span><span
class=GramE><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>N</span></b><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>(</span></span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>N</span></b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>&lt;10). The
next </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>N</span></b><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>
lines contain </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>N</span></b><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>
characters each that fill up the maze. There will be exactly one <i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>S</i> character and one <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>T</i> character. There will be no more than 3 <i style='mso-bidi-font-style:
normal'>X</i> characters in the maze.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
11.0pt;font-family:"Garamond","serif"'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>For
each input, output the case number followed by the minimum number of moves
required. If it is impossible to reach the target, output -1 instead.</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='mso-cellspacing:0in;mso-yfti-tbllook:1184;mso-padding-alt:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes'>
  <td width=226 valign=top style='width:169.45pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
  text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt;font-family:"Garamond","serif"'>Sample Input</span></b><span
  style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=352 valign=top style='width:264.05pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
  text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt;font-family:"Garamond","serif"'>Output for Sample
  Input</span></b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>

  <w:LsdException Locked="false" Priority="68" SemiHidden="false"
   UnhideWhenUsed="false" Name="Medium Grid 2 Accent 4"/>

 <o:shapedefaults v:ext="edit" spidmax="3074"/>

</head>

<body lang=EN-US style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="100%"
 style='width:100.0%;mso-cellspacing:0in;border:outset 1.5pt;mso-yfti-tbllook:
 1184;mso-padding-alt:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
  <table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="100%"
   style='width:100.0%;mso-cellspacing:0in;background:#D9D9D9;border:solid white 1.5pt;
   mso-yfti-tbllook:1184;mso-padding-alt:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
   <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;height:19.5pt'>
    <td width="20%" rowspan=2 style='width:20.0%;border:solid white 1.5pt;
    padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;height:19.5pt'>
    <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:
    auto;text-align:center;line-height:normal'><b><span style='font-size:48.0pt;
    font-family:"Garamond","serif"'>H</span></b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
    font-family:"Garamond","serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
    </td>
    <td width="55%" style='width:55.08%;border:solid white 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;
    height:19.5pt'>
    <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:
    auto;text-align:center;line-height:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
    font-family:Algerian'>NEXT Generation contest - 4<o:p></o:p></span></p>
    </td>
    <td width="24%" rowspan=2 style='width:24.92%;border:solid white 1.5pt;
    padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;height:19.5pt'>
    <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:
    auto;text-align:center;line-height:normal'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
    normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Garamond","serif"'>Time
    Limit  2 seconds<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:1;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
    <td width="55%" valign=bottom style='width:55.08%;border:solid white 1.5pt;
    padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
    <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:
    auto;text-align:center;line-height:normal'><b><span style='font-size:28.0pt;
    font-family:"Garamond","serif"'>Having Fun with Matrices</span></b><span
    style='font-size:28.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>We
have a matrix of size </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>N</span></b><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>
x </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>N</span></b><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>.
Each value of the matrix occupies an integer from [</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
"Courier New"'>0</span></b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>, </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
"Courier New"'>9</span></b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>]. A few operations are going to
be performed on this matrix. We would like to know how the matrix looks like
after these operations are performed sequentially.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>There
could be five different types of operations.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:12.0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:
normal'><span class=GramE><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>row</span></b></span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'> a b<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:12.0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:
normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
"Times New Roman","serif"'>In this operation, row <span class=GramE><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>a</b> is</span> interchanged with row <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>b</b>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:12.0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:
normal'><span class=SpellE><span class=GramE><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
"Times New Roman","serif"'>col</span></b></span></span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
"Times New Roman","serif"'> a b<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:12.0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:
normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
"Times New Roman","serif"'>In this operation, column <span class=GramE><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>a</b> is</span> interchanged with column <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>b</b>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:12.0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:
normal'><span class=GramE><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>inc</span></b></span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:12.0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:
normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
"Times New Roman","serif"'>In this operation, every cell value is increased by
1 (modulo 10). That is, if after adding 1, a cell value becomes 10 we change it
to 0.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:12.0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:
normal'><span class=SpellE><span class=GramE><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
"Times New Roman","serif"'>dec</span></b></span></span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
"Times New Roman","serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:12.0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:
normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
"Times New Roman","serif"'>In this operation, every cell value is decreased by
1 (modulo 10). That is, if after subtracting 1, a cell value becomes -1 we
change it to 9.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:12.0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:
normal'><span class=GramE><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>transpose</span></b></span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:12.0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:
normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
"Times New Roman","serif"'>In this operation, we simply transpose the matrix.
Transposing a matrix, denoted by A<sup>T,</sup> means turning all the rows of
the given matrix into columns and vice-versa.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:12.0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:
normal'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>Example: <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:12.0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:
.5in;line-height:normal'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>1
2 3<span style='mso-tab-count:6'>                             </span>1 4 7<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:12.0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:
.5in;line-height:normal'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>4
5 6<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>    </span></span></b><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
Wingdings;mso-ascii-font-family:"Courier New";mso-hansi-font-family:"Courier New";
mso-bidi-font-family:"Courier New";mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:Wingdings'>à</span></span></b><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'> after transposing </span></b><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
11.0pt;font-family:Wingdings;mso-ascii-font-family:"Courier New";mso-hansi-font-family:
"Courier New";mso-bidi-font-family:"Courier New";mso-char-type:symbol;
mso-symbol-font-family:Wingdings'><span style='mso-char-type:symbol;mso-symbol-font-family:
Wingdings'>à</span></span></b><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><span style='mso-tab-count:1'> </span>2 5 8<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='margin-top:12.0pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:
.5in;line-height:normal'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>7
8 9<span style='mso-tab-count:6'>                             </span>3 6 9<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;line-height:
115%;font-family:"Garamond","serif"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;line-height:
115%;font-family:"Garamond","serif"'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>The
input file starts with an integer <span class=GramE><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'>T</b>(</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>T</b>&lt;50) that
indicates the number of test cases. Each case starts with a positive integer <span
class=GramE>N(</span>N&lt;10) that represents the size of the matrix. The next
N lines contain N integers each. The value of each integer is in the range [0,
9]. Next there is a line with an integer <span class=GramE>M(</span>M&lt;50).
Each of the next M lines contain an operation each. If the command is <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>row a
b</i></b> or <span class=SpellE><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><i
style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'>col</i></b></span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><i style='mso-bidi-font-style:normal'> a b, </i></b>then you can assume
1 &lt;= <span class=SpellE>a<span class=GramE>,b</span></span> &lt;= N and a !=
b.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;line-height:
115%;font-family:"Garamond","serif"'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>For
each case, output the case number on the first line. Then on the next N lines
output the content of the final matrix. Print a blank line after each case
(even after the very last one).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='mso-cellspacing:0in;mso-yfti-tbllook:1184;mso-padding-alt:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes'>
  <td width=226 valign=top style='width:169.45pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
  text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt;font-family:"Garamond","serif"'>Sample Input</span></b><span
  style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=352 valign=top style='width:264.05pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;

<body lang=EN-US link=blue vlink=purple style='tab-interval:.5in'>

<div class=Section1>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="100%"
 style='width:100.0%;mso-cellspacing:0in;border:outset 1.5pt;mso-yfti-tbllook:
 1184;mso-padding-alt:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
  <td style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
  <table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="100%"
   style='width:100.0%;mso-cellspacing:0in;background:#D9D9D9;border:solid white 1.5pt;
   mso-yfti-tbllook:1184;mso-padding-alt:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
   <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes;height:19.5pt'>
    <td width="20%" rowspan=2 style='width:20.0%;border:solid white 1.5pt;
    padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;height:19.5pt'>
    <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:
    auto;text-align:center;line-height:normal'><b><span style='font-size:48.0pt;
    font-family:"Garamond","serif"'>I</span></b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
    font-family:"Garamond","serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
    </td>
    <td width="56%" style='width:56.04%;border:solid white 1.5pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;
    height:19.5pt'>
    <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:
    auto;text-align:center;line-height:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
    font-family:Algerian'>Next generation contest  4<o:p></o:p></span></p>
    </td>
    <td width="23%" rowspan=2 style='width:23.96%;border:solid white 1.5pt;
    padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;height:19.5pt'>
    <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:
    auto;text-align:center;line-height:normal'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
    normal'><span style='font-size:14.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
    "Garamond","serif"'>Time Limit  4 <span class=SpellE>secs</span></span></b><b
    style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
    font-family:"Garamond","serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>
    </td>
   </tr>
   <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:1;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes'>
    <td width="56%" valign=bottom style='width:56.04%;border:solid white 1.5pt;
    padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
    <p class=MsoNormal align=center style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:
    auto;text-align:center;line-height:normal'><b><span style='font-size:28.0pt;
    font-family:"Garamond","serif"'>Investigating Div-Sum Property</span></b><span
    style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
    </td>
   </tr>
  </table>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>An
integer is divisible by 3 if the sum of its digits is also divisible by 3. For
example, 3702 is divisible by 3 and 12(3+7+0+2) is also divisible by 3. This
property also holds for the integer 9.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>In
this problem, we will investigate this property for other integers.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:16.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;line-height:
115%;font-family:"Garamond","serif"'>Input<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='line-height:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>The first line of input is an integer </span><span
class=GramE><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Courier New"'>T</span></b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>(</span></span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>T</span></b><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>&lt;100) that
indicates the number of test cases. Each case is a line containing 3 positive
integers </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:
12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>A</span></b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>, </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>B</span></b><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'> and </span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
"Courier New"'>K</span></b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>.
1 &lt;= </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:
12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>A</span></b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'> &lt;= </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>B</span></b><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'> &lt; 2^31 and
0&lt;</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Courier New"'>K</span></b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>&lt;10000.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:16.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Garamond","serif"'>Output<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal style='line-height:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>For each case,
output the number of integers in the range [</span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
"Courier New"'>A</span></b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>, </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:
"Courier New"'>B</span></b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>] which is divisible by </span><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>K</span></b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'> and the sum
of its digits is also divisible by </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Courier New"'>K</span></b><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'>.</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:16.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<table class=MsoNormalTable border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0
 style='mso-cellspacing:0in;mso-yfti-tbllook:1184;mso-padding-alt:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:0;mso-yfti-firstrow:yes'>
  <td width=226 valign=top style='width:169.45pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
  text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt;font-family:"Garamond","serif"'>Sample Input</span></b><span
  style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=352 valign=top style='width:264.05pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto;
  text-align:justify;line-height:normal'><b><span style='font-size:16.0pt;
  mso-bidi-font-size:18.0pt;font-family:"Garamond","serif"'>Output for Sample
  Input</span></b><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr style='mso-yfti-irow:1;mso-yfti-lastrow:yes;height:42.9pt'>
  <td width=226 valign=top style='width:169.45pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;
  height:42.9pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;line-height:
  normal;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
  style='font-family:"Courier New"'>3<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;line-height:
  normal;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
  style='font-family:"Courier New"'>1 20 1<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;line-height:
  normal;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
  style='font-family:"Courier New"'>1 20 2<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;line-height:
  normal;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
  style='font-family:"Courier New"'>1 1000 4<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
  <td width=352 valign=top style='width:264.05pt;padding:0in 0in 0in 0in;
  height:42.9pt'>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;line-height:
  normal;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
  style='font-family:"Courier New"'>20<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;line-height:
  normal;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
  style='font-family:"Courier New"'>5<o:p></o:p></span></p>
  <p class=MsoNormal style='margin-bottom:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt;line-height:
  normal;tab-stops:45.8pt 91.6pt 137.4pt 183.2pt 229.0pt 274.8pt 320.6pt 366.4pt 412.2pt 458.0pt 503.8pt 549.6pt 595.4pt 641.2pt 687.0pt 732.8pt'><span
  style='font-family:"Courier New"'>64</span><span style='font-size:10.0pt;
  font-family:"Courier New"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<div style='mso-element:para-border-div;border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;
mso-border-bottom-alt:solid windowtext .75pt;padding:0in 0in 1.0pt 0in'>

<p class=MsoNormal style='text-align:justify;border:none;mso-border-bottom-alt:
solid windowtext .75pt;padding:0in;mso-padding-alt:0in 0in 1.0pt 0in'><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:
11.0pt;line-height:115%;font-family:"Times New Roman","serif"'><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></span></b></p>

</div>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-bidi-font-size:11.0pt;
line-height:115%;font-family:"Garamond","serif"'>ProblemSetter: Sohel Hafiz<br>
Special Thanks: Ivan Krasilnikov<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><o:p>&nbsp;</o:p></p>

</div>

</body>

</html>

______________________________________________________
11362||||||false||||||

<!--Converted with LaTeX2HTML 2K.1beta (1.48)
original version by:  Nikos Drakos, CBLU, University of Leeds
* revised and updated by:  Marcus Hennecke, Ross Moore, Herb Swan
* with significant contributions from:
  Jens Lippmann, Marek Rouchal, Martin Wilck and others -->
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Phone List</TITLE>
<META NAME="description" CONTENT="Phone List">
<META NAME="keywords" CONTENT="htmlatex">
<META NAME="resource-type" CONTENT="document">
<META NAME="distribution" CONTENT="global">

<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
<META NAME="Generator" CONTENT="LaTeX2HTML v2K.1beta">
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Style-Type" CONTENT="text/css">

<LINK REL="STYLESHEET" HREF="htmlatex.css">

</HEAD>

<BODY LANG="EN" BGCOLOR=#FFFFFF>

<H1><BR CLEAR=ALL><CENTER><TABLE BGCOLOR=#0000ff><TR><TD><B><FONT SIZE=5 COLOR=#FFff00>&nbsp;<A NAME="SECTION0001000000000000000000">
A: Phone List</A>&nbsp;</FONT></B></TABLE></CENTER>
</H1>

<P>
Given a list of phone numbers, determine if it is consistent in the sense that no number is the prefix of another. Let's say the phone catalogue listed these numbers: 

<P>

<UL>
<LI>Emergency 911 
</LI>
<LI>Alice 97 625 999 
</LI>
<LI>Bob 91 12 54 26 
</LI>
</UL>

<P>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER">
<!-- MATH
 $\epsfbox{p11362.eps}$
 -->
<IMG
 WIDTH="142" HEIGHT="296" ALIGN="right" BORDER="0"
 SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/113/p11362.png" 
 ALT="\epsfbox{p11362.eps}">
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>
</DIV>

<P>
In this case, it's not possible to call Bob, because the central would direct your call to the emergency line as soon as you had dialled the first three digits of Bob's phone number. So this list would not be consistent.

<P>

<H2><FONT size=4 COLOR=#ff0000><A NAME="SECTION0001001000000000000000">
Input</A>&nbsp;</FONT>
</H2>

<P>
The first line of input gives a single integer, <!-- MATH
 $1 \le t \le 40$
 -->
<SPAN CLASS="MATH">1<IMG
 WIDTH="18" HEIGHT="31" ALIGN="MIDDLE" BORDER="0"
 SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/113/p11362.png" 
 ALT="$ \le$"><I>t</I><IMG
 WIDTH="18" HEIGHT="31" ALIGN="MIDDLE" BORDER="0"
 SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/113/p11362.png" 
 ALT="$ \le$">40</SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>, the number of test cases. Each test case starts with <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>n</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>, the number of phone numbers, on a separate line, <!-- MATH
 $1 \le n \le 10000$
 -->
<SPAN CLASS="MATH">1<IMG
 WIDTH="18" HEIGHT="31" ALIGN="MIDDLE" BORDER="0"
 SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/113/p11362.png" 
 ALT="$ \le$"><I>n</I><IMG
 WIDTH="18" HEIGHT="31" ALIGN="MIDDLE" BORDER="0"
 SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/113/p11362.png" 
 ALT="$ \le$">10000</SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>. Then follows <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>n</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> lines with one unique phone number on each line. A phone number is a sequence of at most ten digits.

<P>

<H2><FONT size=4 COLOR=#ff0000><A NAME="SECTION0001002000000000000000">
Output</A>&nbsp;</FONT>
</H2>

<P>
For each test case, output ``<TT>YES</TT>" if the list is consistent, or ``<TT>NO</TT>" otherwise.

<P>

<H2><FONT size=4 COLOR=#ff0000><A NAME="SECTION0001003000000000000000">
Sample Input</A>&nbsp;</FONT>
</H2>

<P>
<PRE>
2 
3 
911 
97625999 
91125426 
5 
113 
12340 
123440 
12345 
98346
</PRE>

<P>

<H2><FONT size=4 COLOR=#ff0000><A NAME="SECTION0001004000000000000000">
Sample Output</A>&nbsp;</FONT>
</H2>

<P>
<PRE>
NO 
YES
</PRE>

<P>


<P>
<BR><HR>

</BODY>
</HTML>
</HTML>

______________________________________________________
11363||||||false||||||

<!--Converted with LaTeX2HTML 2K.1beta (1.48)
original version by:  Nikos Drakos, CBLU, University of Leeds
* revised and updated by:  Marcus Hennecke, Ross Moore, Herb Swan
* with significant contributions from:
  Jens Lippmann, Marek Rouchal, Martin Wilck and others -->
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Cuckoo Hashing</TITLE>
<META NAME="description" CONTENT="Cuckoo Hashing">
<META NAME="keywords" CONTENT="htmlatex">
<META NAME="resource-type" CONTENT="document">
<META NAME="distribution" CONTENT="global">

<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
<META NAME="Generator" CONTENT="LaTeX2HTML v2K.1beta">
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Style-Type" CONTENT="text/css">

<LINK REL="STYLESHEET" HREF="htmlatex.css">

</HEAD>

<BODY LANG="EN" BGCOLOR=#FFFFFF>

<H1><BR CLEAR=ALL><CENTER><TABLE BGCOLOR=#0000ff><TR><TD><B><FONT SIZE=5 COLOR=#FFff00>&nbsp;<A NAME="SECTION0001000000000000000000">
B: Cuckoo Hashing</A>&nbsp;</FONT></B></TABLE></CENTER>
</H1>

<P>
One of the most fundamental data structure problems is the dictionary problem: given a set <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>D</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> of words you want to be able to quickly determine if any given query string <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>q</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> is present in the dictionary <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>D</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> or not. Hashing is a well-known solution for the problem. The idea is to create a function <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>h</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> :  <!-- MATH
 $\sum ^{\ast} \rightarrow [0..n - 1]$
 -->
<SPAN CLASS="MATH"><IMG
 WIDTH="29" HEIGHT="35" ALIGN="MIDDLE" BORDER="0"
 SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/113/11363img1.png" 
 ALT="$ \sum^{{\ast}}_{}$"> <IMG
 WIDTH="22" HEIGHT="16" ALIGN="BOTTOM" BORDER="0"
 SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/113/11363img1.png" 
 ALT="$ \rightarrow$"> [0..<I>n</I> - 1]</SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> from all strings to the integer range <!-- MATH
 $0, 1, \ldots, n - 1$
 -->
<SPAN CLASS="MATH">0, 1,..., <I>n</I> - 1</SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>, i.e. you describe a fast deterministic program which takes a string as input and outputs an integer between 0 and <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>n</I> - 1</SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>. Next you allocate an empty hash table <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>T</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> of size <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>n</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> and for each word <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>w</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> in <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>D</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>, you set <!-- MATH
 $T [h(w)] = w$
 -->
<SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>T</I>[<I>h</I>(<I>w</I>)] = <I>w</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>. Thus, given a query string <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>q</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>, you only need to calculate <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>h</I>(<I>q</I>)</SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> and see if <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>T</I>[<I>h</I>(<I>q</I>)]</SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> equals <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>q</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>, to determine if <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>q</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> is in the dictionary. Seems simple enough, but aren't we forgetting something? Of course, what if two words in <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>D</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> map to the same location in the table? This phenomenon, called collision, happens fairly often (remember the Birthday paradox: in a class of 24 pupils there is more than 50<SPAN CLASS="MATH">%</SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> chance that two of them share birthday). On average you will only be able to put roughly  <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><IMG
 WIDTH="29" HEIGHT="36" ALIGN="MIDDLE" BORDER="0"
 SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/113/11363img1.png" 
 ALT="$ \sqrt{{n}}$"></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>-sized dictionaries into the table without getting collisions, quite poor space usage! 

<P>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER">
<!-- MATH
 $\epsfbox{p11363.eps}$
 -->
<IMG
 WIDTH="228" HEIGHT="171" ALIGN="right" BORDER="0"
 SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/113/11363img1.png" 
 ALT="\epsfbox{p11363.eps}">
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>
</DIV>

<P>
A stronger variant is Cuckoo Hashing (<EM>Cuckoo Hashing was suggested by the danes R. Pagh and F. F. R&#246;dler in 2001</EM>). The idea is to use two hash functions <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>h</I><SUB>1</SUB></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> and <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>h</I><SUB>2</SUB></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>. Thus each string maps to two positions in the table. A query string <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>q</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> is now handled as follows: you compute both <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>h</I><SUB>1</SUB>(<I>q</I>)</SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> and <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>h</I><SUB>2</SUB>(<I>q</I>)</SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>, and if <!-- MATH
 $T [h_{1} (q)] = q$
 -->
<SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>T</I>[<I>h</I><SUB>1</SUB>(<I>q</I>)] = <I>q</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>, or <!-- MATH
 $T [h_{2} (q)] = q$
 -->
<SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>T</I>[<I>h</I><SUB>2</SUB>(<I>q</I>)] = <I>q</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>, you conclude that <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>q</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> is in <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>D</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>. The name ``Cuckoo Hashing" stems from the process of creating the table. Initially you have an empty table. You iterate over the words <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>d</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> in <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>D</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>, and insert them one by one. If <!-- MATH
 $T [h_{1} (d)]$
 -->
<SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>T</I>[<I>h</I><SUB>1</SUB>(<I>d</I> )]</SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> is free, you set <!-- MATH
 $T [h_{1} (d)] = d$
 -->
<SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>T</I>[<I>h</I><SUB>1</SUB>(<I>d</I> )] = <I>d</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>. Otherwise if <!-- MATH
 $T [h_{2} (d)]$
 -->
<SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>T</I>[<I>h</I><SUB>2</SUB>(<I>d</I> )]</SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> is free, you set <!-- MATH
 $T [h_{2} (d)] = d$
 -->
<SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>T</I>[<I>h</I><SUB>2</SUB>(<I>d</I> )] = <I>d</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>. If both are occupied however, just like the cuckoo with other birds' eggs, you evict the word <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>r</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> in <!-- MATH
 $T [h_{1} (d)]$
 -->
<SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>T</I>[<I>h</I><SUB>1</SUB>(<I>d</I> )]</SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> and set <!-- MATH
 $T [h_{1} (d)] = d$
 -->
<SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>T</I>[<I>h</I><SUB>1</SUB>(<I>d</I> )] = <I>d</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>. Next you put <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>r</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> back into the table in its alternative place (and if that entry was already occupied you evict that word and move it to its alternative place, and so on). Of course, we may end up in an infinite loop here, in which case we need to rebuild the table with other choices of hash functions. The good news is that this will not happen with great probability even if <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>D</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> contains up to <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>n</I>/2</SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> words!

<P>

<H2><FONT size=4 COLOR=#ff0000><A NAME="SECTION0001001000000000000000">
Input</A>&nbsp;</FONT>
</H2>

<P>
On the first line of input is a single positive integer <!-- MATH
 $1 \le t \le 50$
 -->
<SPAN CLASS="MATH">1<IMG
 WIDTH="18" HEIGHT="31" ALIGN="MIDDLE" BORDER="0"
 SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/113/11363img1.png" 
 ALT="$ \le$"><I>t</I><IMG
 WIDTH="18" HEIGHT="31" ALIGN="MIDDLE" BORDER="0"
 SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/113/11363img1.png" 
 ALT="$ \le$">50</SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> specifying the number of test cases to follow. Each test case begins with two positive integers <!-- MATH
 $1 \le m \le n \le 10000$
 -->
<SPAN CLASS="MATH">1<IMG
 WIDTH="18" HEIGHT="31" ALIGN="MIDDLE" BORDER="0"
 SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/113/11363img1.png" 
 ALT="$ \le$"><I>m</I><IMG
 WIDTH="18" HEIGHT="31" ALIGN="MIDDLE" BORDER="0"
 SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/113/11363img1.png" 
 ALT="$ \le$"><I>n</I><IMG
 WIDTH="18" HEIGHT="31" ALIGN="MIDDLE" BORDER="0"
 SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/113/11363img1.png" 
 ALT="$ \le$">10000</SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> on a line of itself, <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>m</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> telling the number of words in the dictionary and <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>n</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> the size of the hash table in the test case. Next follow <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>m</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> lines of which the <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>i</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>:th describes the <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>i</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>:th word <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>d</I><SUB>i</SUB></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> in the dictionary <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>D</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> by two non-negative integers <!-- MATH
 $h_{1} (d_{i})$
 -->
<SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>h</I><SUB>1</SUB>(<I>d</I><SUB>i</SUB>)</SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> and <!-- MATH
 $h_{2} (d_{i})$
 -->
<SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>h</I><SUB>2</SUB>(<I>d</I><SUB>i</SUB>)</SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> less than <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>n</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> giving the two hash function values of the word <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>d</I><SUB>i</SUB></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>. The two values may be identical.

<P>

<H2><FONT size=4 COLOR=#ff0000><A NAME="SECTION0001002000000000000000">
Output</A>&nbsp;</FONT>
</H2>

<P>
For each test case there should be exactly one line of output either containing the string ``<TT>successful hashing</TT>" if it is possible to insert all words in the given order into the table, or the string ``<TT>rehash necessary</TT>" if it is impossible.

<P>

<H2><FONT size=4 COLOR=#ff0000><A NAME="SECTION0001003000000000000000">
Sample Input</A>&nbsp;</FONT>
</H2>

<P>
<PRE>
2 
3 3
0 1
1 2
2 0
5 6
2 3
3 1
1 2
5 1
2 5
</PRE>

<P>

<H2><FONT size=4 COLOR=#ff0000><A NAME="SECTION0001004000000000000000">
Sample Output</A>&nbsp;</FONT>
</H2>

<P>
<PRE>
successful hashing 
rehash necessary
</PRE>

<P>


<P>
<BR><HR>

</BODY>
</HTML>
</HTML>

______________________________________________________
11364||||||false||||||

<!--Converted with LaTeX2HTML 2K.1beta (1.48)
original version by:  Nikos Drakos, CBLU, University of Leeds
* revised and updated by:  Marcus Hennecke, Ross Moore, Herb Swan
* with significant contributions from:
  Jens Lippmann, Marek Rouchal, Martin Wilck and others -->
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Optimal Parking</TITLE>
<META NAME="description" CONTENT="Optimal Parking">
<META NAME="keywords" CONTENT="htmlatex">
<META NAME="resource-type" CONTENT="document">
<META NAME="distribution" CONTENT="global">

<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
<META NAME="Generator" CONTENT="LaTeX2HTML v2K.1beta">
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Style-Type" CONTENT="text/css">

<LINK REL="STYLESHEET" HREF="htmlatex.css">

</HEAD>

<BODY LANG="EN" BGCOLOR=#FFFFFF>

<H1><BR CLEAR=ALL><CENTER><TABLE BGCOLOR=#0000ff><TR><TD><B><FONT SIZE=5 COLOR=#FFff00>&nbsp;<A NAME="SECTION0001000000000000000000">
C: Optimal Parking</A>&nbsp;</FONT></B></TABLE></CENTER>
</H1>

<P>
When shopping on Long Street, Michael usually parks his car at some random location, and then walks to the stores he needs. Can you help Michael choose a place to park which minimises the distance he needs to walk on his shopping round? 

<P>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER">
<!-- MATH
 $\epsfbox{p11364.eps}$
 -->
<IMG
 WIDTH="164" HEIGHT="163" ALIGN="right" BORDER="0"
 SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/113/p11364.png" 
 ALT="\epsfbox{p11364.eps}">
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>
</DIV>

<P>
Long Street is a straight line, where all positions are integer. You pay for parking in a specific slot, which is an integer position on Long Street. Michael does not want to pay for more than one parking though. He is very strong, and does not mind carrying all the bags around.

<P>

<H2><FONT size=4 COLOR=#ff0000><A NAME="SECTION0001001000000000000000">
Input</A>&nbsp;</FONT>
</H2>

<P>
The first line of input gives the number of test cases, <!-- MATH
 $1 \le t \le 100$
 -->
<SPAN CLASS="MATH">1<IMG
 WIDTH="18" HEIGHT="31" ALIGN="MIDDLE" BORDER="0"
 SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/113/p11364.png" 
 ALT="$ \le$"><I>t</I><IMG
 WIDTH="18" HEIGHT="31" ALIGN="MIDDLE" BORDER="0"
 SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/113/p11364.png" 
 ALT="$ \le$">100</SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>. There are two lines for each test case. The first gives the number of stores Michael wants to visit, <!-- MATH
 $1 \le n \le 20$
 -->
<SPAN CLASS="MATH">1<IMG
 WIDTH="18" HEIGHT="31" ALIGN="MIDDLE" BORDER="0"
 SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/113/p11364.png" 
 ALT="$ \le$"><I>n</I><IMG
 WIDTH="18" HEIGHT="31" ALIGN="MIDDLE" BORDER="0"
 SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/113/p11364.png" 
 ALT="$ \le$">20</SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>, and the second gives their <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>n</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> integer positions on Long Street, <!-- MATH
 $0 \le x_{i} \le 99$
 -->
<SPAN CLASS="MATH">0<IMG
 WIDTH="18" HEIGHT="31" ALIGN="MIDDLE" BORDER="0"
 SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/113/p11364.png" 
 ALT="$ \le$"><I>x</I><SUB>i</SUB><IMG
 WIDTH="18" HEIGHT="31" ALIGN="MIDDLE" BORDER="0"
 SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/113/p11364.png" 
 ALT="$ \le$">99</SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>.

<P>

<H2><FONT size=4 COLOR=#ff0000><A NAME="SECTION0001002000000000000000">
Output</A>&nbsp;</FONT>
</H2>

<P>
Output for each test case a line with the minimal distance Michael must walk given optimal parking.

<P>

<H2><FONT size=4 COLOR=#ff0000><A NAME="SECTION0001003000000000000000">
Sample Input</A>&nbsp;</FONT>
</H2>

<P>
<PRE>
2 
4 
24 13 89 37 
6 
7 30 41 14 39 42
</PRE>

<P>

<H2><FONT size=4 COLOR=#ff0000><A NAME="SECTION0001004000000000000000">
Sample Output</A>&nbsp;</FONT>
</H2>

<P>
<PRE>
152
70
</PRE>

<P>


<P>
<BR><HR>

</BODY>
</HTML>
</HTML>

11365||||||false||||||

<!--Converted with LaTeX2HTML 2K.1beta (1.48)
original version by:  Nikos Drakos, CBLU, University of Leeds
* revised and updated by:  Marcus Hennecke, Ross Moore, Herb Swan
* with significant contributions from:
  Jens Lippmann, Marek Rouchal, Martin Wilck and others -->
<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>Copying DNA</TITLE>
<META NAME="description" CONTENT="Copying DNA">
<META NAME="keywords" CONTENT="htmlatex">
<META NAME="resource-type" CONTENT="document">
<META NAME="distribution" CONTENT="global">

<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=iso-8859-1">
<META NAME="Generator" CONTENT="LaTeX2HTML v2K.1beta">
<META HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Style-Type" CONTENT="text/css">

<LINK REL="STYLESHEET" HREF="htmlatex.css">

</HEAD>

<BODY LANG="EN" BGCOLOR=#FFFFFF>

<H1><BR CLEAR=ALL><CENTER><TABLE BGCOLOR=#0000ff><TR><TD><B><FONT SIZE=5 COLOR=#FFff00>&nbsp;<A NAME="SECTION0001000000000000000000">
D: Copying DNA</A>&nbsp;</FONT></B></TABLE></CENTER>
</H1>

<P>
Evolution is a seemingly random process which works in a way which resembles certain approaches we use to get approximate solutions to hard combinatorial problems. You are now to do something completely different. 

<P>
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER">
<!-- MATH
 $\epsfbox{p11365.eps}$
 -->
<IMG
 WIDTH="171" HEIGHT="281" ALIGN="right" BORDER="0"
 SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/113/p11365.png" 
 ALT="\epsfbox{p11365.eps}">
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>
</DIV>

<P>
Given a DNA string <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>S</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> from the alphabet {<TT>A</TT>,<TT>C</TT>,<TT>G</TT>,<TT>T</TT>}, find the minimal number of copy operations needed to create another string <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>T</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>. You may reverse the strings you copy, and copy both from <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>S</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> and the pieces of your partial <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>T</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>. You may put these pieces together at any time. You may only copy contiguous parts of your partial <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>T</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>, and all copied strings must be used in your final <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>T</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>. Example: From <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>S</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> = ``<TT>ACTG</TT>" create <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>T</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> = ``<TT>GTACTATTATA</TT>" 

<P>

<UL>
<LI>Get <TT>GT.........</TT> by copying and reversing ``<TT>TG</TT>" from <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>S</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>. 
</LI>
<LI>Get <TT>GTAC.......</TT> by copying ``<TT>AC</TT>" from <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>S</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>. 
</LI>
<LI>Get <TT>GTAC...TA..</TT> by copying ``<TT>TA</TT>" from the partial <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>T</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>. 
</LI>
<LI>Get <TT>GTAC...TAAT</TT> by copying and reversing ``<TT>TA</TT>" from the partial <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>T</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>.
</LI>
<LI>Get <TT>GTACAATTAAT</TT> by copying ``<TT>AAT</TT>" from the partial <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>T</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>.
</LI>
</UL>

<P>

<H2><FONT size=4 COLOR=#ff0000><A NAME="SECTION0001001000000000000000">
Input</A>&nbsp;</FONT>
</H2>

<P>
The first line of input gives a single integer, <!-- MATH
 $1 \le t \le 100$
 -->
<SPAN CLASS="MATH">1<IMG
 WIDTH="18" HEIGHT="31" ALIGN="MIDDLE" BORDER="0"
 SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/113/p11365.png" 
 ALT="$ \le$"><I>t</I><IMG
 WIDTH="18" HEIGHT="31" ALIGN="MIDDLE" BORDER="0"
 SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/113/p11365.png" 
 ALT="$ \le$">100</SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>, the number of test cases. Then follow, for each test case, a line with the string <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>S</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> of length <!-- MATH
 $1 \le m \le 18$
 -->
<SPAN CLASS="MATH">1<IMG
 WIDTH="18" HEIGHT="31" ALIGN="MIDDLE" BORDER="0"
 SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/113/p11365.png" 
 ALT="$ \le$"><I>m</I><IMG
 WIDTH="18" HEIGHT="31" ALIGN="MIDDLE" BORDER="0"
 SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/113/p11365.png" 
 ALT="$ \le$">18</SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>, and a line with the string <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>T</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> of length <!-- MATH
 $1 \le n \le 18$
 -->
<SPAN CLASS="MATH">1<IMG
 WIDTH="18" HEIGHT="31" ALIGN="MIDDLE" BORDER="0"
 SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/113/p11365.png" 
 ALT="$ \le$"><I>n</I><IMG
 WIDTH="18" HEIGHT="31" ALIGN="MIDDLE" BORDER="0"
 SRC="http://uva.onlinejudge.org/external/113/p11365.png" 
 ALT="$ \le$">18</SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>.

<P>

<H2><FONT size=4 COLOR=#ff0000><A NAME="SECTION0001002000000000000000">
Output</A>&nbsp;</FONT>
</H2>

<P>
Output for each test case the number of copy operations needed to create <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>T</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark> from <SPAN CLASS="MATH"><I>S</I></SPAN>
<tex2html_verbatim_mark>, or ``<TT>impossible</TT>" if it cannot be done.

<P>

<H2><FONT size=4 COLOR=#ff0000><A NAME="SECTION0001003000000000000000">
Sample Input</A>&nbsp;</FONT>
</H2>

<P>
<PRE>
5 
ACGT 
GTAC 
A 
C 
ACGT 
TGCA 
ACGT 
TCGATCGA 
A 
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA
</PRE>

<P>

<H2><FONT size=4 COLOR=#ff0000><A NAME="SECTION0001004000000000000000">
Sample Output</A>&nbsp;</FONT>
</H2>

<P>
<PRE>
2 
impossible 
1 
4 
6
</PRE>

<P>


<P>
<BR><HR>

</BODY>
</HTML>
</HTML>
